activation.jar. I have more than one activation jar. Then how to exclude 
others as they are used for other s/w so i can't delete them.How to change 
classpath so that search should be in the desired directory. If anybody knows 
tell me from where to change the classpath.

thanks in advance for the help.

Kathy Chan reassigning defect on behalf of Chris Brealey:

Are you using Eclipse WTP 0.7?  We found a similar problem with 

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/activation/DataSource

with drivers around end of July leading to WTP 0.7 with Tomcat 4.1.  That 
problem had been fixed in WTP 0.7.  Could you please retry with WTP 0.7? 
 
If you did found the problem with WTP 0.7, please provide detail steps to 
reproduce the problem including JDK version, Tomcat version and operation 
system.

Hi Chris,

I see the same problem that Kathy described using:
  - Eclipse 3.1
  - WTP 0.7
  - Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
    Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cn1420-20040626 
    (JIT enabled: jitc))

To create the problem, I created a Dynamic Web Project that had a WSDL file,
then I attempted to "General a Java Bean skeleton". It fils dunring the
generation process.

Based on the configuration Edmund gave me in comment #6 and from a chat with 
him to clarify what server he was running on, here's the configuration I tried:

- Eclipse WTP 0.7
- IBM JDK 142 (J2RE 1.4.2 IBM windows 32 build cn142-200507609"
- Tomcat 5.5.9 with compatibility JARs running on the same IBM JDK 142

I was able to run through the bottom-up, top-down and client tutorials no 
problem.  I aslo tried Tomcat 5.5.9 running with JDK 1.5 and that was all OK as 
well.

There must be something different with the configuration you had problem with 
and the configuration I tried.  Please provide more detail steps to see if I 
could recreate the problem. Thanks!

I've tried putting mail.jar and activation.jar in org.apache.axis_1.2.1/lib,
updated MANIFEST.MF and restart with "-clean".  The problem went away for
Geronimo server which has a similar problem of NoClassDefFound with
javax.activiation.DataSource (see bugzilla 108156 for more detail).  

The detail steps are:

1. Shutdown Eclipse.
2. Add activation.jar and mail.jar to org.apache.axis_1.2.1/lib/.
3. Add an entry for it (ie. "lib/activation.jar,", "lib/mail.jar") to
org.apache.axis_1.2.1/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF.
4. Restart with -clean.

I am suspecting there's javax.activation.DataHandler in one of the JARs in
the Java build path of the project containing the Java bean you want to
create Web service for.  See defect 105335 and Axis defect 2146 
(http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS-2146).

You could find out what JARs are included in the
Java build path by right-clicking on the project, select properties, then
Java Build path and go to the library tab.  We would appreciate if you could
find the name of the JAR(s) containing javax.activation.DataHandler and
append the info in this defect.

I tried Kathy's steps (from reply #8), which worked for Geronimo, and it fixed 
my problem as well. I was able to do a top-down generation of the bean skeleton 
and deploy the web service without problems.

In my case, the project has only one instance of the 
javax.activation.DataHandler class, in the activation.jar JAR file. Not sure 
what else may be the environment differences.

Created an attachment (id=27194)
.options file to put in the eclipse directory

From chatting with Edmund, it seems like he has activation.jar in the project 
classpath (it's not put of server lib).  

Edmund, could you please place the .option file in the eclipse directory (the 
directory containing "eclipse.exe" and starts eclipse with "eclipse -debug"?  
When you go through the bottom-up scenario, you should see something like the 
following in the command console:

IWAB5008I 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.consumption.core.command.Java2WSDLCommand@1ae53
e9::executAntTask: object=Class Path = ...

Check if the activation.jar you have in the project classpath is in that Class 
Path variable.

I'm guessing this exception should be handled(In reply to comment #14)

Updating the bug summary so that this bug does not get used for other problem that caused "Unexpected Exception occured".  Let's just use this bug for the original "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/activation/DataSource" problem.

Bug 121186 had been opened for the problem with ClasspathUtils.getUtilityJarClasspath in comment 13.

Kris, please open a seperate defect for the problem reported in comment #15 with a detail description of the steps to reproduce the problem. Thanks!
*** Bug 122613 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The user would run into this problem if targetting Geronimo server since the following Geronimo JARs contains javax.activation.DataSource and are put on the Web project's classpath if targetting Geronimo server (if using 01/11 or later Geronimo plugins):

- geronimo-activation_1.0.2_spec-1.0.jar
- geronimo-j2ee_1.4_spec-1.0.jar

The workaround is to exclude the above JARs in ClasspatnUtils when figuring out the classpath to pass to the Axis emitter.

The attached patch (source and JAR) can be used as a workaround when generating Web service using Geronimo until a more elegant solution can be found for the more general problem.

Created an attachment (id=33000)
Patch for jst.ws.axis.consumption.ui - workaround for Geronimo

Created an attachment (id=33001)
JAR for jst.ws.axis.consumption.ui - workaround for Geronimo

Replace org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.consumption.ui_1.0.0.jar in eclipse/plugins directory for WTP 1.0 or WTP 1.0.1 to workaround the problem with getting Web services to work using Geronimo server.

is being tracked with bug 119111.  It happens when there is no server runtime installed in the workspace.  The workaround is to install a server runtime using Windows -> Preferences -> Servers -> Install runtime.

To workaround other DataSource NoClassDefFoundError, you could try the workaround in comment #8.

For the record, this is proving to be a juicy bug to solve. We're exploring classloader behaviour between Ant and Eclipse to try and deal with this problem without having to alter and rebuild Apache Axis, however, altering Axis may end up being necessary. I'm targetting this to 1.0.1 to insure it appears on the list of bugs we are attempting to solve for that release, however, this is not a guarantee we will be able to actually solve it in 1.0.1.

Despite posting to the axis-users mailing list and asking for an update on the Axis bug (http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS-2146), I was not getting any response.

So we are trying to solve the problem by working around it in WTP.

The error from the Axis emitter is:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/activation/DataSource
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:141)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.ser.JAFDataHandlerSerializerFactory.class$(JAFDataHandlerSerializerFactory.java:37)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.ser.JAFDataHandlerSerializerFactory.getSerializerClass(JAFDataHandlerSerializerFactory.java:46)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.ser.JAFDataHandlerSerializerFactory.<init>(JAFDataHandlerSerializerFactory.java:34)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DefaultTypeMappingImpl.initMappings(DefaultTypeMappingImpl.java:120)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DefaultTypeMappingImpl.<init>(DefaultTypeMappingImpl.java:91)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DefaultTypeMappingImpl.getSingletonDelegate(DefaultTypeMappingImpl.java:85)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.TypeMappingRegistryImpl.<init>(TypeMappingRegistryImpl.java:155)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.TypeMappingRegistryImpl.<init>(TypeMappingRegistryImpl.java:149)
	at org.apache.axis.wsdl.fromJava.Emitter.<clinit>(Emitter.java:747)
	at org.apache.axis.tools.ant.wsdl.Java2WsdlAntTask.execute(Java2WsdlAntTask.java:172)
	at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.consumption.core.command.Java2WSDLCommand.executeAntTask(Java2WSDLCommand.java:163)

I tried switching the thread's context class loader to a custom classloader(EclipseClassloader + AntClassloader based on the classpath of the Web project) before calling the Java2WSDLAntTask in the Java2WSDLCommand.  

However, JAFSerializerFactory and org.apache.axis.wsdl.fromJava.Emitter are still using the Eclipse classloader (not the custom classloader).   

I then tried calling Java2WSDLAntTask in secondary thread.  However, the Emitter did not solve the problem.

Even after changing the code in JAFSerializerFactory to use ClassUtils.forName() (which uses the classpath from the Web project), the problem is still there.

The failure occurs when the org.apache.axis.wsdl.fromJava.Emitter is being initialized.

When DefaultTypeMappingImpl.initMappings() is called, JavaUtils.isAttachmentSupported returns true because ClassUtils.forName() (the one that has the Web project's classpath containing activation.jar) is used to load javax.activation.DataHandler.

if (JavaUtils.isAttachmentSupported()) {
            myRegister(Constants.MIME_PLAINTEXT, java.lang.String.class,
                    new JAFDataHandlerSerializerFactory(
                            java.lang.String.class,
                            Constants.MIME_PLAINTEXT),
                    new JAFDataHandlerDeserializerFactory(
                            java.lang.String.class,
                            Constants.MIME_PLAINTEXT));
        }

In JAFDataHandlerDeserializerFactory:

private static Class getSerializerClass(Class javaType, QName xmlType) {
        Class ser;
        if (Image.class.isAssignableFrom(javaType)) {
            ser = ImageDataHandlerSerializer.class;
        }
        else if (String.class.isAssignableFrom(javaType)) {
            ser = PlainTextDataHandlerSerializer.class;
        }
//...
        return ser;
}

While loading the class PlainTextDataHandler, the classloadder is trying to load org.xml.sax.Attributes and javax.activation.DataHandler which are in the serialize method.  Commenting the method out proves that the classloader tries to load those classes during initialization even though the method is not called.  This is a problem because activation.jar and mail.jar are not shipped in the org.apache.axis plugin in WTP because of license agreement issues.  That's why we are getting a NoClassDefFound on javax.activation.DataSource.

So, to workaround the problem, we put together a few empty interfaces and classes so that the org.apache.wsdl.fromJava.Emitter can initialize properly.  The dummy javaxzombie.jar contains:

javax/activation/DataSource.class
javax/activation/DataHandler.class
javax/mail/Multipart.class
javax/mail/internet/MimeMultipart.class

After putting the javaxzombie.jar in the lib directory and updating the manifest file for org.apache.axis to include the JAR, the NoClassDefFound for javax.activation.DataSource is solved.

Created an attachment (id=34230)
Patch for axis.consumption.core

Created an attachment (id=34232)
Patch for axis.consumption.ui

Created an attachment (id=34233)
Patch for org.apache.axis

Created an attachment (id=34235)
javazombie.jar

Use this JAR to replace the javazombie.jar in org.apache.axis/lib directory after applying the patch for attachment 34233 (since JARs are not included properly in patch).

Patches reviewed with Chris.  Patches committed and released as v200602062208 to both HEAD and M101.  The fix will be showing up in this week's build.

Once the Axis bug 2146 is fixed, WTP bug 105407 will be used to revert the workaround (i.e. remove the patch made to org.apache.axis for including javazombie.jar).  The 2 other patches to axis.consumption.core and axis.consumption.ui were to improve error reporting and removing previous workaround for Axis bug 2146 as part of WTP bug 105335.  Those 2 can stay.
*** Bug 127722 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
